text: Approved shop drawings for formwork available on-site
Form materials (plywood, steel, timber) clean and undamaged
All formwork built to correct dimensions, levels, and alignment
Forms erected per structural and architectural drawings
Surface treatment applied as per specification (form release agent, if required)
Bracing and supports installed to prevent movement or deflection during pour
Shores, walers, and ties installed per formwork design
Adequate support provided for horizontal formwork and suspended slabs
All block-outs, sleeves, and box-outs in correct location and secure
Anchor bolts, dowels, and embeds installed as per approved layout
Electrical/MEP embeds coordinated and placed prior to closing forms
Access for concrete placement (pumps, hoses, chutes) verified
Openings for vibrator placement and form cleaning provided
Surfaces moistened prior to placement (if required)
Tolerances within CSA A23.1 / NBC standards
Edge forms level and aligned (check top of slab)
Safety measures in place (guardrails, signage, ladders, etc.)
Pre-pour inspection performed and signed by responsible authority
Photos taken for record prior to concrete placement
All approvals obtained from QA/QC, structural, and client (if applicable)

id: • CSA A23.1 – Concrete Materials & Methods of Construction
• NBC Part 9 and 4 – General & Structural Design
• ACI 347 – Guide to Formwork for Concrete (optional)
